issues.description: The problem statement contains an internal contradiction about the return type of getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): the textual task description (lines 43-45) says the method should return a String in the format "LectureName (TotalNumberOfStudents)", but the UML diagram (line 71) declares the method as returning void. The solution implements getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents() as returning String. Because the problem text explicitly tells students to check the UML for expected return types, this mismatch can confuse students about whether to implement a void method or one that returns a String, and may lead to incorrect implementations or test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the specification consistent: change the UML entry for getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents() to return String (i.e. +getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents(): String) so it matches the textual description and the solution. Also ensure the template includes the method stub with the correct signature (public String getNameAndTotalNumberOfStudents()) so students have an unambiguous signature to implement.
